text: Happy Cheltmas everyone!! For those of us who aren't just working the numbers but genuinely love the game of horse racing, biggest week of the year - at least as important as Christmas to my mind! :slightly_smiling_face:

text: I would prefer to see an Aussie open to be honest which is right on your doorstep? I find Wimbldon a bit of a bore fest these days unless you get a great final between 2 top players. As a tournament it reeks of snobbery masked as "tradition". Big serves make it just dull dull dull. Give me Roland Garros any day of the week over SW19.

text: <@U4H19D1D2> did you ever get involved with Wimbledon debentures then? I used to run auctions for a previous employer!

elements.text: did you ever get involved with Wimbledon debentures then? I used to run auctions for a previous employer!

text: I looked into it about 3/4 yrs ago but it seemed like too much work, looked worth it if you like watching tennis

elements.text: I looked into it about 3/4 yrs ago but it seemed like too much work, looked worth it if you like watching tennis

text: It was...got a bit pricey though, especially as you normally had to buy a pair

elements.text: It was...got a bit pricey though, especially as you normally had to buy a pair

text: that said as you could split them out, if you didn't mind missing the finals you could sell those off and see most of the rest. Also actually if I remember correctly as you paid in instalments, you could theoretically put down the first payment and sell before the next one, generating a pretty substantial ROI (given the way prices shot up)!

text: On the Cheltenham hospitality: I got an invite to the betfair tent on the Tuesday back in 2017 based on my exchange _games_ activity (another story). Was the year that Elliott's man turned up and gave his nap of the day as Labaik and everybody thought he'd been at the free bar a bit early but he made a compelling case. Got on at a nice price, paid for all my muggy bets the rest of the week and then some.

elements.text: On the Cheltenham hospitality: I got an invite to the betfair tent on the Tuesday back in 2017 based on my exchange
games

activity (another story). Was the year that Elliott's man turned up and gave his nap of the day as Labaik and everybody thought he'd been at the free bar a bit early but he made a compelling case. Got on at a nice price, paid for all my muggy bets the rest of the week and then some.

text: Amazed that I reckon I was the only person I spoke to that day though who saw a horse. Everyone else glued to the TVs and the free bar.

elements.text: Amazed that I reckon I was the only person I spoke to that day though who saw a horse. Everyone else glued to the TVs and the free bar.

text: On Wimbledon debentures: was still a sound investment if you had the cash a couple of years back. Pretty liquid market for selling them on. Not sure if that'll remain if we don't have strong British players in years to come.

elements.text: On Wimbledon debentures: was still a sound investment if you had the cash a couple of years back. Pretty liquid market for selling them on. Not sure if that'll remain if we don't have strong British players in years to come.

text: I'm not that keen of the BF events because I don't like seeing the VIPs but it might be fun to get BF to take us to the races all together one day when things are normal. You get to take a date so managed accounts could take newer players.

text: What do you think the threshold is to be a 'managed' account?

elements.text: What do you think the threshold is to be a 'managed' account?

text: Think it's normally about £300k but some people are managed on a lot less if they generate a lot of comm or charges or for other reasons.

elements.text: Think it's normally about £300k but some people are managed on a lot less if they generate a lot of comm or charges or for other reasons.

text: It may also have gone down recently as they did a bit of a push, recruited more managers and tried a bit harder.

elements.text: It may also have gone down recently as they did a bit of a push, recruited more managers and tried a bit harder.

text: Is the metric that BF ultimately care about the £ comms we generate or do they want high deposits as well?
